page.title: 15THE PUBS IN THE AREA 3
page.content: and football. The 'Travellers Joy' has a plaque, dated 1806, on the outside wall. Within memory it was one of five cottages, of which only one other is still standing, and sold beer by the jug. Now it has a 'sixties' jukebox with pictures of the Beatles . Despite the hanging baskets, with geraniums, lobelia, and begonias, it does not offer meals like the 'service' pubs. The landlord of 'The Station' admits that he gets his living from 'the food'. Over the last few years he has transformed the pub from a local, where men from the works would congregate into a 'snacks' pub. Clients come from the town centre for a cheap snack and a pint. His daughter has just completed a catering course and one of the services he offers, is to 'take' meals to firms in Telford, when they are having meetings etc.
